name: dubtrack.fm - Better chat
description: Intended for tinkerers who want to make their community's DubX theme look better, but can be used as-is by those who just want Dubtrack to look better overall.
additional_info: Introduction All of the provided code isn't just for making the chat look better, but also to make the chat more modder-friendly, allowing for different colours per user. Great for bots of people of a higher / privileged position. You can technically do the above without this modification, but #chat UL doesn't reach the edges of .right_section, so changing colour per-user looks a little funny. That, and because .right_section is made transparent, you can use transparent colours for different users and it would render as one would expect. The rest of it is just pushing things around to where they were originally when #chat UL had padding. There are also gaps in both private messages and the chat because of how .ps-container is positioned, this style fixes that. How to test object spacing Add a border to #chat LI and see how it looks. As dumb as it may sound, hitting your print screen key or using a screen grabbing utility will allow you to determine by pixels in a raster editor the spacing of items. ShareX is actually really great at this, allowing for a chose-up grid of a small magnified portion to find where you want to start capturing a region. Taking advantage of this, you can peep at pixels without needing to save everything you want to check as an image with print screen. GitHub release and updating This will be updated as the UI changes; This should be the only revision for a little while. I lied. Sorry about that. if you don't wish to install Stylish or want to use the code straight away for your community, you can find it on Github, where you can merge and edit to your community's desire. Get it here. Updates 11/17/15 In my haste to publish this, I forgot about chat options needing background color, and the avatar list's gradient hack. Oops! Also disabled the white border from showing, since it's a debug function for object spacing anyway. 11/19/15 Quick fix for user list to make it not overlap chat tools. 11/24/15 I unfortunately could not find a way to simplify the process of selecting a background color for everything like I wanted to. Maybe when CSS4 is released, I'll try out more pragmatic declarations to make selecting a background colour for everything way, way easier. This version now includes selective user highlight in the user list, as well as chat so users can have different background colours in both the chat and user list. Due to this change, a semi-transparent hover colour can be defined for option buttons for people who want that. 12/03/15 Deleted messages are now modified. 12/11/15 Don't ask why i glossed over this detail earlier, but the queue song button (.play-song-link) didn't have its proper default colour before. 08/18/16 A very overdue fix for the user sort button, and a fix for the background colour. 11/24/16.1 Made it so the background hack for chat options is the only thing that changed colour since due to some wide-sweeping changes to Dubtrack's UI, there's little possibility, at least without overly-complicated coding to have buttons that change colour on hover. There's been some rearrangement too where it counts. 11/24/16.2 Forgot that Dubtrack changed what class they used for join notifications in chat. This update resolves that. 12/12/16 Added overdue changes used in other parts of my code. 12/14/16 Added leave notification
